intro: Ornithogalum canadense, commonly known as Canadian star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its upright, grass-like foliage and clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and blooms in late spring to early summer. Its bulbs are underground storage organs that allow it to survive harsh conditions and regenerate each growing season. The plant is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas.
